thread.title: Girls who found Odom unconscious take break from Love Ranch
thread.title_full: Girls who found Odom unconscious take break from Love Ranch

author: EDGAR SANDOVAL, LARRY McSHANE
title: Girls who found Odom unconscious take break from Love Ranch
text:
Share this URL loveranch.net Prostitutes Ryder Cherry and Monica Monroe (pictured) found Lamar Odom unconcious at Denis Hof's Love Ranch Vegas on Tuesday. Enlarge loveranch.net Prostitutes Ryder Cherry (pictured) and Monica Monroe found Lamar Odom unconcious at Denis Hof's Love Ranch Vegas on Tuesday. Enlarge 
Prostitutes Ryder Cherry (r.) and Monica Monroe (l.) found Lamar Odom unconcious at Denis Hof's Love Ranch Vegas on Tuesday. 
The two blonde beauties who joined a hard-partying Lamar Odom on the night before he nearly died were missing from the action Thursday at the Love Ranch Vegas. 
“I don’t know where,” said Lawanna Olberding, shift manager at the busy brothel in Crystal, Nev. “They’re gone. They are getting away from all this.” 
Ryder Cherry and Monica Monroe were the two hookers summoned to Odom’s room on Monday. The one-time NBA Sixth Man of the Year asked the pair to leave later that night. 
The same duo returned to find him unconscious and unresponsive on Tuesday afternoon, about nine to 12 hours after they departed. All Access Photo Group/All Access Photo Group Lamar Odom remains on life support after he was found unconscious inside the VIP villa on Tuesday. Ken Murray/NEW YORK DAILY NEWS The bedroom that Lamar Odom was discovered in the Love Ranch Vegas. 
The furor surrounding Odom’s wild four-day stay at the brothel owned by Dennis Hof — a reality show regular in his own right — led to a new temporary policy at the business: No walk-in customers. 
Typically, the brothel’s working girls would turn out en masse to greet new arrivals without a reservation. 
“We’re on hold right now, (sex) by appointment only,” explained Olberding. “That’s it. There are some girls here who just work by appointment. They don’t stay here. They have appointments they book months in advance. Alex Wong/Getty Images Signs advertising Dennis Hof's Love Ranch in Crystal, Nevada. 
There was no sign at the ranch of the typically loquacious Hof, whose famous Bunny Ranch house of prostitution was featured in an HBO series. 
He owns seven Nevada brothels, all open 24/7, and boasts more than 500 employees.
